LETTERS To ATTICUS XVI. 11-12

About the holidays for Lepidus' inauguration,¹ Balbus tells me they will last till the 29th. Ι am looking for a letter from you, and hope l shall hear about that little affair of Torquatus. I am sending Quintus’ letter to show you how strong his affection is for the youth for whom he regrets you have so little: Please give Attica a kiss in my name for being such a merry little thing. It is the best sign in children.

XII

exemto TO ATTICUS, GREETING.

1 am sending you a copy of Oppius’ letter, because Puteoli, it is so very courteous. About Ocella, while you Nov. 6, ac. are messing about and not writing me a line, 144 have consulted my own wits, and so I think I shall be in Rome on the 12th. Ι think it better for me to come there to no purpose, even if it is not necessary, than not to be there if it is, and at the same time Ι am afraid of being shut in there.

For Antony may always be getting near. However, there are plenty of different rumours, which I hope may be true; there is no definite news. For my part, whatever it may be, I would rather be with you, than be in suspense both about you and about myself‚ when 1 am away from you. But what am I to say to you? Keep up your beart. About Varro’s work in Heracleides' vein, that’s an amusing business. I was never so pleased with anything. But of this and more important things when we

meet. ¹ As Pontifex Maximus.
